China's Feb factory activity likely contracted for fifth monthChina's manufacturing activity likely contracted for a fifth straight month in February, a Reuters poll showed on Thursday, possibly increasing the clamour for further stimulus measures as factory owners struggle for orders both at home and abroad. Thu, 29 Feb 2024 05:12:03 GMT NOWYYBC3FBNXXIU5FHOOLFELGQ https://www.reuters.com/markets/asia/chinas-feb-factory-activity-likely-contracted-fifth-month-2024-02-29/Joe Cash市场宏观问题
WTA roundup: Chinese duo heads to ATX Open quarterfinalsNo. 8 seed Yue Yuan of China and countrywoman Yafan Wang both completed sweeps on Wednesday in the second round of the ATX Open in Austin, Texas. Thu, 29 Feb 2024 04:19:03 GMT 7ZB5E5MTBVIAPFZTFCBRBCNVBY https://www.reuters.com/sports/tennis/wta-roundup-chinese-duo-heads-atx-open-quarterfinals-2024-02-29/Reuters运动的网球
Dollar braces for US inflation reading, yen gains on BOJ commentsThe U.S. dollar held firm on Thursday in the lead up to U.S. inflation data that could ruffle the interest rate outlook, while the yen found its footing after comments from Bank of Japan official hinted at the need to exit ultra-easy policies. Thu, 29 Feb 2024 04:10:11 GMT 3TICQVS4HBK5FIOOABCYZ2QKYI https://www.reuters.com/markets/currencies/dollar-braces-us-inflation-reading-yen-gains-boj-comments-2024-02-29/Tom Westbrook市场货币
In delicate China play, Reckitt turns to livestreaming to sell condomsDurex-owner Reckitt is hoping that Chinese consumers' penchant for livestream shopping will also extend to purchases of condoms, but the company will have to toe a "delicate line" as it looks to grow its slice of the $5-billion-plus condom market. Thu, 29 Feb 2024 04:04:48 GMT F7AITOOZCBOTPBNFJVADULMG4I https://www.reuters.com/business/retail-consumer/delicate-china-play-reckitt-turns-livestreaming-sell-condoms-2024-02-29/Richa Naidu, Casey Hall商业零售与消费品
Calls for Australian spy chief to name ex-politician who 'sold out'Australia’s spy chief faced calls on Thursday to name the former politician he said had “sold out” to a foreign intelligence service, with Canberra’s former ambassador to the United States saying it could “potentially smear everyone” unless the person was identified. Asia hedge fund launches drop to lowest number in 14 years as China interest wanesOnly 62 new hedge funds launched in Asia last year, the lowest since number since 2009 and just 15 were China-focused funds, data provider Preqin said. Asia stocks sputter before US inflation data; yen gainsAsian equities were mostly weaker on Thursday, while the dollar and U.S. Treasuries were largely steady ahead of crucial U.S. inflation data that could provide fresh clues on when the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates. North Korea's Kim seeks 'industry revolution' in rural areas amid widening inequalityNorth Korean leader Kim Jong Un has called for an "industry revolution" in rural regions by building factories nationwide, state media KCNA said on Thursday, amid chronic food shortages and widening economic inequality. Volkswagen, Xpeng say first jointly made car will be electric SUVGerman automaker Volkswagen and Chinese electric vehicle (EV) partner XPeng on Thursday said the first car they plan to develop together will be an SUV for which they will jointly source parts.
